intro: Tithymalus carniolicus, commonly known as the Carpathian tithymale, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms during the summer months. Tithymalus carniolicus is often found in open, sunny areas and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat.
